nodes.bodyText:
They are pod level annotations, and jobMaster and jobWorker are part of the pod as a container.
I am using the below annotations for prometheus
        prometheus.io/scrape: "true"
        prometheus.io/port: "19999"
        prometheus.io/path: "/metrics/prometheus/"

nodes.bodyText:
nit: If .Values.metrics.enabled=true but .Values.metrics.podAnnotations is removed, this will throw an error.
I guess you need .Values.metrics.enabled=true and .Values.metrics.PrometheusMetricsServlet.enabled=true before creating this?
It is there to add all the annotations specified in the master.podAnnotations as well as metrics.podAnnotations and as default values as {} provided it will not throw an error.
Does it make sense to have metrics.podAnnotations when Prometheus is not enabled? If yes then I'm good with this part.

I am not sure whether adding metadata via annotations will be useful for other metrics systems such as Graphite or Jmx hence keeping it when enabling metrics, given annotations will be applied to the pod. So that any other tool can use that metadata to automate the tasks.
I think you can mention something like Add a table of keys and default values for the Helm templates in README

nodes.bodyText:
I tested manually and this path seems to be wrong. When you mount the configmap alluxio-metrics to this path, it will be a directory:
[ec2-user@KubernetesSingleMasterLocal-masters-1 ~]$ kubectl exec -it alluxio-master-0 bash
Defaulting container name to alluxio-master.
Use 'kubectl describe pod/alluxio-master-0 -n default' to see all of the containers in this pod.
bash-4.4$ cd /config
bash-4.4$ ls -al -R
.:
total 0
drwxr-xr-x    3 root     root            32 Dec 16 08:38 .
drwxr-xr-x    1 root     root            65 Dec 16 08:38 ..
drwxrwsrwx    3 root     alluxio         85 Dec 16 08:38 metrics.properties
./metrics.properties:
total 0
drwxrwsrwx    3 root     alluxio         85 Dec 16 08:38 .
drwxr-xr-x    3 root     root            32 Dec 16 08:38 ..
drwxr-sr-x    2 root     alluxio         32 Dec 16 08:38 ..2020_12_16_08_38_53.343245412
lrwxrwxrwx    1 root     root            31 Dec 16 08:38 ..data -> ..2020_12_16_08_38_53.343245412
lrwxrwxrwx    1 root     root            25 Dec 16 08:38 metrics.properties -> ..data/metrics.properties
./metrics.properties/..2020_12_16_08_38_53.343245412:
total 4
drwxr-sr-x    2 root     alluxio         32 Dec 16 08:38 .
drwxrwsrwx    3 root     alluxio         85 Dec 16 08:38 ..
-rw-r--r--    1 root     alluxio        507 Dec 16 08:38 metrics.properties

Therefore, in order for this to work, this line should be {{- $metricsConfFile := "-Dalluxio.metrics.conf.file=/config/metrics.properties/metrics.properties" }}

Could you change the configmap alluxio-metrics to be mounted to /config/metrics and make -Dalluxio.metrics.conf.file=/config/metrics/metrics.properties? Let's distinguish the directory name with the config file name.
@jiacheliu3 , thanks for finding this out. Yes, totally make sense to differentiate the directory and then the config file name. This is fixed now.
